titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Mary Engelberg Movie Script for The Winner TAM.242
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-02-13T15:50-0500

did.unittitle: Mary Engelberg Movie Script for The Winner

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: The collection consists of the one movie script by Mary Engelberg entitled The Winner. The movie begins in 1936 in Monessen, PA, and chronicles the rise of a corrupt union official.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mary Engelberg, aka Mary Engel, was the author of a labor-themed movie script/screenplay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of The Winner, a movie script/screenplay (114 pp.) It begins in 1936 in a union hall, in Monessen, PA (the local union represents workers at the "Spartacus Tin Plate Company"). It concludes years later with union corruption and murder, with the word "winner" in the title apparently referring to a corrupt union official who rose out of the rank and file.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Mary Engelberg, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 1995. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary Engelberg, 1995. The accession number associated with this gift is 1995.021.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Mary Engelberg Movie Script for The Winner; TAM.242; Box 1; Folder 1; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
